snippet: After the Hall of Famer Bob Feller died in 2010, the business model for his museum in Van Meter, Iowa, began to fail. The building was sold to the city for a new city hall.
abstract: Bob Feller Museum in Van Meter, Iowa, one of country's last free-standing museums devoted to single baseball player, closes after failing to meet operating expenses since 2010 death of former Cleveland Indians pitcher; museum building will be used as city hall and memorabilia will be distributed to various locations.
lead_paragraph: After the Hall of Famer Bob Feller died in 2010, the business model for his museum in Van Meter, Iowa, began to fail. The building was sold to the city for a new city hall.

headline.seo: Bob Feller Museum in Van Meter, Iowa, Will Become City Hall
headline.main: In Town Where Pitcher’s 266 Wins Were Part of Fabric, One Big Loss
headline.print_headline: In Town Where Feller’s 266 Wins Are Part of Fabric, One Big Loss
